intro: Cnidoscolus multilobus, commonly known as the giant arrowhead, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves with deep lobes, which give it its common name. The plant produces yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by edible, spiny fruits. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their anti-inflammatory properties. The plant thrives in moist, humid environments and is often found near rivers and in tropical rainforests.
